Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
overlapping \overlapping\ adj. 1. same as {clinker-built}; -- of ships.
Syn: lap-jointed, lap-strake, lap-straked, lap-streak, lap-streaked. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
overlapping \overlapping\ n. A covering with an overlapping design, as with tiles or shingles.
Syn: imbrication, lapping. [WordNet 1.5]

overlapping adj 1: related by having something in common with or coinciding with; "having overlapping duties"; "found unexpected overlapping areas of interest" 2: laid overlapping (not flush) [syn: {lap-jointed}, {lap-strake}, {lap-straked}, {lap-streak}, {lap-streaked}] n : covering with a design in which one element covers a part of another (as with tiles or shingles) [syn: {imbrication}, {lapping}]

overlap n 1: a representation of common ground between theories or phenomena; "there was no overlap between their proposals" [syn: {convergence}, {intersection}] 2: the property of partial coincidence in time 3: a flap that lies over another part; "the lap of the shingles should be at least ten inches" [syn: {lap}] v 1: coincide partially or wholly; "Our vacations overlap" 2: extend over and cover a part of; "The roofs of the houses overlap in this crowded city" [also: {overlapping}, {overlapped}]
